speaker: Liam
text: Hey, have you figured out what’s causing the CPU spike?
ipa: heɪ, həv ju ˈfɪɡjɚd aʊt wʌts ˈkɔzɪŋ ðə ˌsiːˌpiːˈjuː spaɪk?
stress: HEY, have you FIGURED OUT what’s CAUSING the CPU SPIKE?
linking:
"have you" → /həv ju/ (v + y linking)
"figured out" → /ˈfɪɡjɚd aʊt/ (d + a linking)

speaker: Sara
text: I’m still looking into it. I’m pretty sure it’s related to the latest release. The new analytics job might be responsible for the load increase.
ipa: aɪm stɪl ˈlʊkɪŋ ˈɪntu ɪt. aɪm ˈprɪti ʃʊr ɪts rɪˈleɪtɪd tu ðə ˈleɪtəst rɪˈliːs. ðə nu ˌænəˈlɪtɪks dʒɑb maɪt bi rɪˈspɑnsəbl fɔr ðə loʊd ˈɪnkriːs.
stress: I’m STILL LOOKING into it. I’m PRETTY SURE it’s RELATED to the LATEST RELEASE. The NEW ANALYTICS JOB might be RESPONSIBLE for the LOAD INCREASE.
linking:
"looking into" → /ˈlʊkɪŋ ˈɪntu/ (g + i linking)
"responsible for" → /rɪˈspɑnsəbl fɔr/ (l + f linking)

speaker: Liam
text: Yeah, we talked about that at stand-up. Did you hear about the report from the SRE team?
ipa: jæ, wi tɔkt əˈbaʊt ðæt æt ˈstænd ʌp. dɪd ju hɪr əˈbaʊt ðə rɪˈpɔrt frəm ðə ˌɛsˌɑrˈiː tim?
stress: YEAH, we TALKED about that at STAND-UP. Did you HEAR about the REPORT from the SRE TEAM?
linking:
"talked about" → /tɔkt əˈbaʊt/ (d + a linking)
"hear about" → /hɪr əˈbaʊt/ (r + a linking)

speaker: Sara
text: Not yet. I’ve just written to Priya asking if she can pull the latest Grafana logs. I hate relying on incomplete data.
ipa: nɑt jɛt. aɪv dʒəst ˈrɪtən tu ˈpriːjə ˈæskɪŋ ɪf ʃi kæn pʊl ðə ˈleɪtəst ɡrəˈfɑnə lɔɡz. aɪ heɪt rɪˈlaɪɪŋ ɑn ˌɪnkəmˈplit ˈdeɪtə.
stress: NOT YET. I’ve just WRITTEN to PRIYA asking if she can PULL the LATEST GRAFANA LOGS. I HATE relying on INCOMPLETE DATA.
linking:
"written to" → /ˈrɪtən tu/ (n + t linking)
"hate relying" → /heɪt rɪˈlaɪɪŋ/ (t + r linking)

speaker: Liam
text: Same. By the way, I apologised for the confusion I caused earlier — I mistook the error as coming from Redis. But it was actually caused by a loop in the new queue worker.
ipa: seɪm. baɪ ðə weɪ, aɪ əˈpɑlədʒaɪzd fɔr ðə kənˈfjuʒən aɪ kɔzd ˈɜrliər — aɪ mɪsˈtʊk ði ˈɛrər əz ˈkʌmɪŋ frəm ˈrɛdɪs. bət ɪt wəz ˈækʧuəli kɔzd baɪ ə lup ɪn ðə nu kju ˈwɜrkər.
stress: SAME. By the WAY, I APOLOGISED for the CONFUSION I CAUSED EARLIER — I MISTOOK the ERROR as COMING from REDIS. But it was ACTUALLY CAUSED by a LOOP in the NEW QUEUE WORKER.
linking:
"apologised for" → /əˈpɑlədʒaɪzd fɔr/ (d + f linking)
"caused by" → /kɔzd baɪ/ (d + b linking)

speaker: Sara
text: Ah, thanks for clearing that up. I count on you to spot weird async behavior before anyone else.
ipa: ɑ, θæŋks fɔr ˈklɪrɪŋ ðæt ʌp. aɪ kaʊnt ɑn ju tu spɑt wɪrd ˈeɪsɪŋk bɪˈheɪvjər bɪˈfɔr ˈɛniwʌn ɛls.
stress: AH, THANKS for CLEARING that UP. I COUNT on YOU to SPOT WEIRD ASYNC BEHAVIOR before ANYONE ELSE.
linking:
"thanks for" → /θæŋks fɔr/ (s + f linking)
"count on" → /kaʊnt ɑn/ (t + o linking)

speaker: Liam
text: Haha, thanks. We should prepare for a retro on this next week — I insisted on documenting everything this time.
ipa: hɑhɑ, θæŋks. wi ʃʊd prɪˈpɛr fɔr ə ˈrɛtroʊ ɑn ðɪs nɛkst wik — aɪ ɪnˈsɪstɪd ɑn ˈdɑkjəˌmɛntɪŋ ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ ðɪs taɪm.
stress: HAHA, THANKS. We SHOULD PREPARE for a RETRO on THIS NEXT WEEK — I INSISTED on DOCUMENTING EVERYTHING this TIME.
linking:
"should prepare" → /ʃʊd prɪˈpɛr/ (d + p linking)
"documenting everything" → /ˈdɑkjəˌmɛntɪŋ ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ/ (g + e linking)

speaker: Sara
text: Good call. And let’s aim for a patch release by Friday.
ipa: ɡʊd kɔl. ənd lɛts eɪm fɔr ə pæʧ rɪˈlis baɪ ˈfraɪdeɪ.
stress: GOOD CALL. And LET’S AIM for a PATCH RELEASE by FRIDAY.
linking:
"let’s aim" → /lɛts eɪm/ (s + a linking)
"patch release" → /pæʧ rɪˈlis/ (ch + r linking)
